H0.text: Overhunting was the most likely cause of extinction of the heath hen, an extinct small wild fowl that was a relative of the prairie chicken.

H1.text: Stable climate was the most likely cause of extinction of the heath hen, a small wild fowl that was a relative of the prairie chicken.

H2.text: Plentiful food supply was most likely the cause of extinction of the heath hen, an extinct small wild fowl that was a relative of the prairie chicken.

H3.text: Abundant nesting sites most likely caused the extinction of the heath hen, an extinct small wild fowl that was a relative of the prairie chicken.

A4.text: Owing to intense hunting pressure, and possible habitat loss, the population declined rapidly.

A5.text: they were hunted by settlers extensively for food.
